newsitem.title: USA: President Kennedy aide McGeorge Bundy dead at 77.
newsitem.headline: President Kennedy aide McGeorge Bundy dead at 77.

text.p: McGeorge Bundy, a top aide to Presidents John Kennedy and Lyndon Johnson and an architect of American policy in Vietnam, died on Monday of a heart attack at Massachusetts General Hospital (MGH), hospital officials said. He was 77.
Bundy was admitted on Saturday to the hospital, according to a hospital spokeswoman.

A Republican who supported President Eisenhower in 1952 and 1956, Bundy was appointed Special Assistant on National Security by Democrat Kennedy in 1961. He continued in that position under President Johnson.
He leaves four sons, Stephen of Berkeley, Calif., Andrew of Watertown, Mass., William of Northampton, Mass., and James of New York City.
Survivors also include two brothers and two sisters.
